body:
If this isn't exactly the same issue as I referenced in the linked discussion, then it's a new different issue that needs to be opened against dotnet/runtime.

If you can repro it without Polly even being involved, then it's not an issue in our code, and not something we can reasonably work around either.

If you read the linked issue, you'll see that the runtime maintainers are choosing not to implement thread safety, which makes it the burden on this library not to invoke Validator from multiple threads.

The issue I linked from the discussion was to do with thread safety and validation attributes, and was marked as resolved by the poster, hence I assumed that it was either the same, or if it wasn't that it would still be their bug to fix if not (the issue I linked to _was_ fixed).

If that's not the case and it's something we need to do something about, then we'll happily accept a pull request if you'd like to address it if you'd like to expedite a fix.

issue.body:
# Pull Request

## The issue or feature being addressed

[[Bug]: InvalidCastException when multiple threads retrieve pipeline](https://github.com/App-vNext/Polly/issues/2412)

## Details on the issue fix or feature implementation

.NET team has targeted a fix in v10 of the runtime. In the meantime, I've opted for a simple workaround that synchronizes validation calls for all strategy options models (these are the only ones that use `RangeAttribute`). Given this only occurs when a pipeline is first built, I don't feel like we need to be concerned about contention.

## Confirm the following

- [X]  I started this PR by branching from the head of the default branch
- [X]  I have targeted the PR to merge into the default branch
- [X]  I have included unit tests for the issue/feature
- [X]  I have successfully run a local build

body:
> The issue I linked from the discussion was to do with thread safety and validation attributes, and was marked as resolved by the poster

The [fix you are referring to](https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/issues/97037) is for .NET source generated options validation (using [`OptionsValidatorAttribute`](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/microsoft.extensions.options.optionsvalidatorattribute)). Polly's Core library does not reference `Microsoft.Extensions.Options` and instead leverages `Validator` to perform options validation. Per https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/issues/110917, .NET team now seems amenable to fixing this in the runtime, but I have opened a pull request in the hope this can be addressed in the meantime.

Thanks for creating this issue @kmcclellan - the associated changes have been published as part of version 8.5.1 :package:, which is now available from NuGet.org :rocket:
